TunableTuple.name: posture
TunableTuple.description: A posture constraint mimics requirements normally derived from animation. They can specify what posture the Sim must be in, which includes the body posture (for example, sitting or standing), requiring an object to be held or that one or more hands be empty, and the presence of a surface object. They can also require a parenting relationship between participants in the interaction, such as when a bowl of food must be paced in a particular type of slot on a table.

TunableEnum.name: body_target_tuning
TunableEnum.description: The body target of the posture.

TunableList.name: posture_manifest_tuning
TunableList.description: A list of posture manifests this interaction should support.

TunableTuple.description: A posture manifests this interaction should support.

TunableVariant.name: carry_back
TunableVariant.description: tuning for requirements for carry back. either any, none, or animation participant

TunableVariant.name: carry_left
TunableVariant.description: tuning for requirements for carry left. either any, none, or animation participant

TunableVariant.name: carry_right
TunableVariant.description: tuning for requirements for carry right. either any, none, or animation participant

TunableVariant.name: compatibility
TunableVariant.description: posture level. upper body, full body or any

TunableVariant.name: posture_type
TunableVariant.description: The posture required by this constraint

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The posture required by this constraint

TunableVariant.name: surface
TunableVariant.description: tuning for requirements for surface. either any, none, or animation participant

TunableTuple.name: object_definitions
TunableTuple.description: A Tunable Filter that filters based on specific object definitions.

TunableList.name: items_to_check
TunableList.description: A List of the definitions that can be matched to fulfill the filter. This list is considered a Match Any requirement.

Tunable.description: A reference to a definiton that can be matched as part of the filter.

TunableTuple.name: object_tags
TunableTuple.description: A Tunable Filter that filters based on a tag set.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: A Set of tags that can be matched to fulfill the filter. The set is considered a Match Any requirement.

TunableEnum.description: A reference to a tag that can be matched as part of the filter.

TunableList.name: slot_manifest_tuning
TunableList.description: A list of slot requirements that will be OR'd together for this interaction.

TunableTuple.description: A slot requirement for this interaction. Adding a slot manifest will require the specified relationship between actors to exist before the interaction runs. If the child object is carryable, the transition system will attempt to have the Sim move the child object into the correct type of slot.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: If used, the transition system will find an empty slot of the specified type in which an object of this definition can fit.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: If this is CREATE_TARGET, the transition system will find an empty slot of the specified type in which the object being created by the interaction will fit.

TunableTuple.name: relative_circle
TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint whose size is dependent on the size of the target object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

TunableVariant.name: maximum_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the generated constraint will have a radius no larger that the specified amount.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The constraint's maximum radius.

TunableVariant.name: minimum_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the generated constraint will have a radius no smaller than the specified amount.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The constraint's minimum radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces. Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

TunableVariant.name: relative_ideal_radius
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an ideal radius relative to the constraint's radius.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Ideal radius data.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's relative ideal radius. A value of 1 would mean the ideal location is on the outskirt of the constraint; values towards 0 approach the constraint's center.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also scores to 1 instead of starting to fall off to 0 in scoring. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, any goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will all score optimially.

Tunable.name: relative_radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's radius relative to the size of the object. This is a simple multiplier applied to the area generated by the object's footprint

TunableTuple.name: animation_element
TunableTuple.description: The animation to use when generating the RoutingSlot constraint.

TunableTuple.name: overrides
TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

Tunable.name: balloon_chance
Tunable.description: The chance that the balloon will play.

TunableList.name: balloon_choices
TunableList.description: A list of the balloons and balloon categories

Tunable.name: balloon_delay
Tunable.description: If set, the number of seconds after the start of the animation to trigger the balloon. A negative number will count backwards from the end of the animation.

Tunable.name: balloon_delay_random_offset
Tunable.description: The amount of randomization that is added to balloon requests. Will always offset the delay time later, and requires the delay time to be set to a number. A value of 0 has no randomization.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

TunableList.name: prop_state_values
TunableList.description: Tunable mapping from a prop actor name to a list of state values to set. If conflicting data is tuned both here and in the 'props' field, the data inside 'props' will override the data tuned here.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of state values that will be set on the specified actor.

Tunable.description: A new state value to apply to prop_actor.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_object_in_inventory
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows looking for and using a favorite object in the Sim's inventory.

Tunable.name: actor_asm_name
Tunable.description: The name of the actor in the ASM. This is usually 'x' or 'y'.

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: If the Sim has a favorite object of this type currently in their inventory, it will be used as the prop override. If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

This tuning will be ignored if object_by_participant already tuned.

TunableVariant.name: set_as_actor
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the prop defined by override will be set as an actor of the ASM. This is used in cases like setting the chopsticks prop on the eat ASM. In this ASM the chopsticks are set as an Object actor so they can animate. Currently we do not support props playing their own animations.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: Actor name that will be used on the ASM for the prop animation.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

Tunable.name: actor_name
Tunable.description: The actor that is to be used as a key.

TunableTuple.description: This key is a literal string. It's independent of anything that might be set on the ASM.

Tunable.description: The state to apply on the props from the actor listed above.

TunableVariant.name: reactionlet
TunableVariant.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Reactionlets are short, one-shot animations that are triggered via x-event. X-events are markers in clips that can trigger an in-game effect that is timed perfectly with the clip. Ex: This is how we trigger laughter at the exact moment of the punchline of a Joke It is EXTREMELY important that only content authored and configured by animators to be used as a Reactionlet gets hooked up as Reactionlet content. If this rule is violated, crazy things will happen including the client and server losing time sync.

TunableTuple.description: The overrides for interaction to replace the tunings on the animation elements

Tunable.name: animation_context
Tunable.description: Animation Context - If checked, this animation will get a fresh animation context instead of reusing the animation context of its Interaction. Normally, animation contexts are shared across an entire Super Interaction. This allows mixers to use a fresh animation context. Ex: If a mixer creates a prop, using a fresh animation context will cause that prop to be destroyed when the mixer finishes, whereas re-using an existing animation context will cause the prop to stick around until the mixer's SI is done.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect

NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

TunableVariant.name: balloons
TunableVariant.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Balloons lets you add thought and talk balloons to animations. This is a great way to put extra flavor into animations and helps us stretch our content by creating combinations. Balloon Animation Target is the participant who should display the balloon. Balloon Choices is a reference to the balloon to display, which is its own tunable type. Balloon Delay (and Random Offset) is how long, in real seconds, to delay this balloon after the animation starts. Note: for looping animations, the balloon will always play immediately due to a code limitation. Balloon Target is for showing a balloon of a Sim or Object. Set this to the participant type to show. This setting overrides Balloon Choices.

TunableList.name: manifests
TunableList.description: Manifests is a complex and seldom used override that lets you change entries in the posture manifest from the ASM. You can see how the fields, Actor, Family, Level, Specific, Left, Right, Back, and Surface, match the manifest entries in the ASM.

TunableList.name: params
TunableList.description: This tuning is used for overriding parameters on the ASM to specific values. These will take precedence over those same settings coming from runtime so be careful! You can enter a number of overrides as key/value pairs: Name is the name of the parameter as it appears in the ASM. Value is the value to set on the ASM. Make sure to get the type right. Parameters are either booleans, enums, or strings. Ex: The most common usage of this field is when tuning the custom parameters on specific objects, such as the objectName parameter.

If the Sim doesn't have a favorite of this type, or their favorite is not currently in their inventory, a random object found in their inventory with this tag will be used as the prop override. If there aren't any objects with this tag in the Sim's inventory then the prop override will fall back to the tuned Definition.

TunableVariant.name: sharing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this prop may be shared across ASMs.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: With this override tuned, different ASMs can share the same prop. A key can be built out of several elements that allow multiple shares to be active at the same time. No new prop is created if a share is active. Instead, an existing prop is returned and all events operate on that prop (be careful if the animation has visibility events that hide the prop). Conversely, no prop is destroyed until all shares are deactivated. This allows the sharing to be interleaved, such two shares don't necessarily have to relinquish their claim on the prop in inverse order. e.g.: * Sims can leash multiple dogs at the same time (using either hand). For the same hand, there are multiple leashes but only one leash holder prop, which needs to be shared. When the last 'Leash' interaction for that hand ends, the leash holder needs to be destroyed.

TunableList.name: key
TunableList.description: A list of elements that form the key for this share. For keys that are identical, props are shared.

TunableVariant.name: mirrored_effect
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the is_mirrored parameter comes through as True, we will play this effect instead of the tuned override. NOTE: if you tune this, the non-mirrored version must also be tuned in the regular effect override for it to play. For example, the Bubble Bottle needs to play mirrored effects for left handed Sims, but if we don't override the effect and still want to play a mirrored version, we need to specify the original effect so we don't play nothing.

TunableVariant.name: target_joint_offset
TunableVariant.description: Overrides the target joint offset of the VFX. This is used in case of point to point VFX where we want the effect to reach a destination offset from the target joint.

Tunable.name: find_front_door
Tunable.description: If True the constraint will try and locate the front door on the lot and use that location before using the spawn points. If False the spawn points will always be used. The tuning for the spawn tags is in sim_info_types.tuning.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: ideal distance for this front door constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

Tunable.name: target_to_self
Tunable.description: If enabled, the constraint will be targeting to the sim having this modifier. If disabled, the constraint will be targeting to the target of the autonomy aop candidate.

TunableList.name: commodities_to_add
TunableList.description: Commodites that are added while this autonomy modifier is active. These commodities are removed when the autonomy modifier is removed.

Tunable.name: commodities_value_persist_for_travel
Tunable.description: If checked, value of commodities added from this modifier will persist through travel. This only works for commodities those have 'Persisted Tuning' checked. Also please note commodities themselves won't persist, we record their value before travel and set the value back once arrived the destination. If not checked, value of commodities added from this modifier will not persist through travel. Commodities will be re-added and start from their initial value. Ex: Check this for Buff_Trait_Loner's autonomy modifier will make its attached Commodity_Trait_Loner_Solitude's value persist through travel. So when the sim arrives another lot, the commodity's value will be set back to that just before the travel, so its 'Happy Loner' buff can persist as a consequence.

Tunable.description: The stat the modifier will apply to.

Tunable.name: locked_stats_autosatisfy_on_unlock
Tunable.description: If true, locked stats will be set to the value on the auto satisfy curve when unlocked. If false they will remain as-is. (i.e. maxed)

TunableList.name: object_tags_that_override_off_lot_autonomy
TunableList.display: Object Tags That Override Off Lot Autonomy
TunableList.description: A list of object tags for objects that are always valid to be considered for autonomy regardless of their on-lot or off-lot status. Note that this will only override off-lot autonomy availability. It doesn't affect other ways that objects are culled out. For example, if an object list is passed into the autonomy request (like when we're looking at targets of a crafting phase), we only consider the objects in that list. This won't override that list.

TunableVariant.name: off_lot_autonomy_rule
TunableVariant.description: The rules to apply for how autonomy handle on-lot and off-lot targets. DEFAULT: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius. ON_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot. SHARED_SPACE_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the shared space of active lot. OFF_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot. UNLIMITED: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status. FESTIVAL: Sims will consider all objects within the festival area. ANCHORED: Sims will only consider objects within a tuned radius of autonomy anchor objects. Anchor objects can be objects that match a tag, sims that match a buff, or set by external systems. BUSINESS_EMPLOYEE: Sims will not use objects that are in a Private Dynamic Area BUSINESS_CUSTOMER: Sims will not use objects that are in a Private Dynamic Area or Employee only Dynamic Area

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The rules to apply for how autonomy handle on-lot and off-lot targets. DEFAULT: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius. ON_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot. SHARED_SPACE_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the shared space of active lot. OFF_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot. UNLIMITED: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status. FESTIVAL: Sims will consider all objects within the festival area. ANCHORED: Sims will only consider objects within a tuned radius of autonomy anchor objects. Anchor objects can be objects that match a tag, sims that match a buff, or set by external systems. BUSINESS_EMPLOYEE: Sims will not use objects that are in a Private Dynamic Area BUSINESS_CUSTOMER: Sims will not use objects that are in a Private Dynamic Area or Employee only Dynamic Area

TunableTuple.name: anchored
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot.

TunableVariant.name: anchor_buff
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the autonomy anchor to all sims that match the tuned buff.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The buff in question.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

TunableVariant.name: buff_source
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The tuning file that applied this buff. This is typically tuned to be the same file that this buff is being tuned on. This is NOT player facing, and is used for telemetry only.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: anchor_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the autonomy anchor to all objects that match the tuned tag.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to find an object to be an anchor.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the anchoring point in which the sim will consider objects. This point must be set on the autonomy component. Designers: Please make sure this autonomy modifier is attached to a role or other other gameplay system that will correctly set the anchoring point before you set this. Or set the anchor tag on this tunable.

TunableTuple.name: business_customer
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider objects located in public area defined by dynamic areas.

TunableTuple.name: business_employee
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider objects located in public and employee only areas defined by dynamic areas.

TunableTuple.name: default_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim in which he will consider off-lot objects. If it is 0, the Sim will not consider off-lot objects at all. This is not recommended since it will keep them from running any interactions unless they are already within the tolerance for that lot (set with Off Lot Tolerance).

Tunable.name: tolerance
Tunable.description: This is how many meters the Sim can be off of the lot while still being considered on the lot for the purposes of autonomy. For example, if this is set to 5, the sim can be 5 meters from the edge of the lot and still consider all the objects on the lot for autonomy. If the sim were to step 6 meters from the lot, the sim would be considered off the lot and would only score off-lot objects that are within the off lot radius.

TunableTuple.name: off_lot_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim in which he will consider off-lot objects. If it is 0, the Sim will not consider off-lot objects at all. This is not recommended since it will keep them from running any interactions unless they are already within the tolerance for that lot (set with Off Lot Tolerance).

TunableTuple.name: on_lot_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot.

TunableTuple.name: restricted
TunableTuple.description: Sims will consider all objects in the restricted open street autonomy area. This is defined by points in world builder so please make sure that world builder has setup the objects before trying to use this option.

TunableTuple.name: shared_space_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets on the shared space/common space of active lot.

TunableTuple.name: unlimited
TunableTuple.description: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status.

TunableVariant.name: only_scored_static_commodities
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the sim in this role state will consider ONLY these static commodities when doing autonomy. EX: for walkbys, only consider the ringing the doorbell

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of statistics that will only be considered when doing autonomy.

TunableVariant.name: only_scored_stats
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the sim in this role state will consider ONLY these stats when doing autonomy. EX: for the maid, only score commodity_maidrole_clean so she doesn't consider doing things that she shouldn't care about.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of statistics that will only be considered when doing autonomy.

TunableVariant.name: outside_objects_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, objects that are outside will have their interaction scores modified unless they are tagged with 'counts_as_inside'.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Amount to multiple the autonomy score by.

TunableVariant.name: override_convergence_value
TunableVariant.description: If enabled it will set a new convergence value to the tuned statistics. The decay of those statistics will start moving toward the new convergence value. Convergence value will apply as long as these modifier is active, when modifier is removed, convergence value will return to default tuned value. As a tuning restriction when this modifier gets removed we will reset the convergence to its original value. This means that we don't support two states at the same time overwriting convergence so we should'nt tune multiple convergence overrides on the same object.

TunableList.name: Set_new_convergence_value
TunableList.description: Mapping of statistic to new convergence value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: Value to which the statistic should convert to.

Tunable.name: prevent_skills_from_being_added
Tunable.description: If enabled, prevents all skills from being added for the duration that the autonomy modifier is active. Does not remove preexisting skills that already exist on the object.

TunableVariant.name: provided_affordance_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: Tune this to provide suppression to certain affordances when an object has this autonomy modifier. EX: Tune this to exclude all on the buff for the maid to prevent other sims from trying to chat with the maid while the maid is doing her work. To tune if this restriction is for autonomy only, etc, see super_affordance_suppression_mode. Note: This suppression will also apply to the owning sim! So if you prevent people from autonomously interacting with the maid, you also prevent the maid from doing self interactions. To disable this, see suppress_self_affordances. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.)

TdescFragTag.name: literal
TdescFragTag.description: An affordance filter.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: relationship_score_multiplier_with_buff_on_target
TunableList.display: Relationship Score Multiplier With Buff On Target
TunableList.description: Mapping of buffs to multipliers. The buff must exist on the TARGET sim. If it does, this value will be multiplied into the relationship score. Example: The make children desire to socialize with children, you can add this autonomy modifier to the child's age buff. You can then map it with a key to the child buff to apply a positive multiplier. An alternative would be to create a mapping to every other age and apply a multiplier that is smaller than 1.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The buff that the target sim must have to apply this multiplier.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply.

TunableList.name: score_multipliers
TunableList.description: Mapping of statistics to multipliers values to the autonomy scores. EX: giving motive_bladder a multiplier value of 2 will make it so that that motive_bladder is scored twice as high as it normally would be.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The stat the multiplier will apply to.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The autonomy score multiplier for the stat. Multiplies autonomy scores by the tuned value.

TunableList.name: situation_type_social_score_multiplier
TunableList.description: A tunable mapping form situation type to multiplier to apply when the target Sim is in a situation of the specified type with the actor Sim.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: A reference to the type of situation that both Sims need to be in together in order for the multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply.

TunableList.name: skill_tag_modifiers
TunableList.description: The skill_tag to float mapping of skill modifiers. Skills with these tags will have their amount gained multiplied by the sum of all the tuned values.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: What skill tag to apply the modifier on.

TunableList.name: stat_use_multiplier
TunableList.description: List of stats and multiplier to affect their increase-decrease. All stats on this list whenever they get modified (e. by a constant modifier on an interaction, an interaction result...) will apply the multiplier to their modified values. e. A toilet can get a multiplier to decrease the repair rate when its used, for this we would tune the commodity brokenness and the multiplier 0.5 (to decrease its effect) This tunable multiplier will affect the object statistics not the ones for the sims interacting with it.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The stat the multiplier will apply to.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Float value to apply to the statistic whenever its affected. Greater than 1.0 if you want to increase. Less than 1.0 if you want a decrease (>0.0). A value of 0 is considered invalid and is skipped.

TunableEnum.name: apply_direction
TunableEnum.description: Direction on when the multiplier should work on the statistic. For example a decrease on an object brokenness rate, should not increase the time it takes to repair it.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: Float value to apply to the statistic whenever its affected. Greater than 1.0 if you want to increase. Less than 1.0 if you want a decrease (>0.0). A value of 0 is considered invalid and is skipped.

TunableList.name: static_commodity_score_multipliers
TunableList.description: Mapping of statistics to multipliers values to the autonomy scores. EX: giving motive_bladder a multiplier value of 2 will make it so that that motive_bladder is scored twice as high as it normally would be.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The static commodity the multiplier will apply to.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The autonomy score multiplier for the static commodity. Multiplies autonomy scores by the tuned value.

TunableVariant.name: subject
TunableVariant.description: Specifies to whom this autonomy modifier will apply. - Apply to owner: Will apply the modifiers to the object or sim who is triggering the modifier. e.g Buff will apply the modifiers to the sim when he gets the buff. An object will apply the modifiers to itself when it hits a state. - Apply to interaction participant: Will save the modifiers to be only triggered when the object/sim who holds the modifier is on an interaction. When the interaction starts the the subject tuned will get the modifiers during the duration of the interaction. e.g A sim with modifiers to apply on an object will only trigger when the sim is interactin with an object.

TunableVariant.name: apply_on_interaction_to_participant
TunableVariant.description: Subject on which the modifiers should apply. When this is set it will mean that the autonomy modifiers will trigger on a subect different than the object where they have been added. e.g. a shower ill have hygiene modifiers that have to affect the Sim

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Subject on which the modifiers should apply. When this is set it will mean that the autonomy modifiers will trigger on a subect different than the object where they have been added. e.g. a shower ill have hygiene modifiers that have to affect the Sim

Tunable.name: super_affordance_suppress_on_add
Tunable.description: If checked, then the suppression rules will be applied when the modifier is added, potentially canceling interactions the owner is running.

TunableEnum.name: super_affordance_suppression_mode
TunableEnum.description: Setting this defines how to apply the settings tuned in Super Affordance Compatibility.

Tunable.name: suppress_preroll_autonomy
Tunable.description: If checked, sims with this buff will not run preroll autonomy when first loading into a lot. This means that when the loading screen disappears, they will be standing exactly where they spawned, looking like a chump, instead of being somewhere on the lot doing a normal-looking activity. As soon as the loading screen disappears, all bets are off and autonomy will run normally again.

Tunable.name: suppress_self_affordances
Tunable.description: If checked, the super affordance compatibility tuned for this autonomy modifier will also apply to the sim performing self interactions. If not checked, we will not do provided_affordance_compatibility checks if the target of the interaction is the same as the actor. Ex: Tune the maid's provided_affordance_compatibility to exclude all so that other sims will not chat with the maid. But disable suppress_self_affordances so that the maid can still perform interactions on herself (such as her No More Work interaction that tells her she's finished cleaning).

TunableVariant.name: supress_outside_objects_if_sun_out
TunableVariant.display: Supress Outside Objects If Sun Out
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, objects on the outside will be suppressed by autonomy if the sun is out (i.e. region provides light, it's daytime, and weather isn't too cloudy) and will not be used unless they have interactions tagged with 'counts_as_inside'.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: When checked, outside objects will be suppressed, otherwise supression will be canceled. Canceling suppression will have a higher priority than an active supression, this is to support cases like vampire buffs always being suppressed, but when they activate the daywalker power, that cancelation of suppression should always have a higher priority.

TunableList.name: tested_relationship_score_multipliers
TunableList.description: List of TestSet and relationship multiplier tuples. For each tuple, if the Sim passes the TestSet, the corresponding multiplier will be multiplied into the relationship score.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The relationship multiplier to apply.

TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: transition_from_sit_posture_penalty
TunableVariant.description: When enabled causes the Sim to be penalized for transitioning from Sit to another posture.

Instance.TunableVariant: <Tunable type="float" name="enabled" class="Tunable" default="1.0" display="Enabled" description="The multiplier to apply to the autonomous interaction score as a result of the Sim transitioning from sit to something else. This number should be less than one (<1) in order for it to be a penalty, otherwise it will be a bonus." tuning_state="NeedsTuning" group="General" />

TunableTuple.name: tile_count
TunableTuple.description: Modify the statistic based on the tile count of the lot. If the user enters build buy we will not recalculate this value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: A multiplier to the tile count.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic to be modified by the state.

TunableTuple.name: periodic_statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: The stat change apply on the target within the state value.

Tunable.name: interval
Tunable.description: The number of sim minutes in between each application of the tuned operations. Note: This operation sets an alarm, which has performance implications, so please see a GPE before setting to a number lower than 5 mins.

TunableTuple.description: Statistic Change Operation will apply on object without interaction involved.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The one-time gain for this operation.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description: The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring. NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins. Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance. IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time. Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point. RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior. APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description: Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format: amount *= statistic.value

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The payout amount will be multiplied by this statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to look for the specified statistic on.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableList.name: tunable_multipliers
TunableList.description: List of multipliers to be applied when gaining amount

TunableList.name: multipliers

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests

TunableVariant.name: awareness

TunableVariant.name: apply_new_value

TunableTuple.name: start_awareness

TunableList.description: A mapping of awareness channels and scores. The score is cumulative, with all requests for the same channel contributing to an object's awareness source score.

TunableVariant.name: change_value
TunableVariant.description: Operation to change the current value of the target object and potenitally add that value to the running total of insurance owed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Operation to change the current value of the target object and potenitally add that value to the running total of insurance owed.

Tunable.name: change_percentage
Tunable.description: A percentage of the catalog value to modify the current value of the target. It will either decrease or increase the value of the object based on the setting of reduce_value.

Tunable.name: covered_by_insurance
Tunable.description: If checked it means that the user will be awarded an insurance payment for the value lost. Currently this only happens with fire insurance and there is seperate tuning in the fire service for how much of the reduction is awarded as part of the insurance. NOTE: There is a tunable percent of the value that get's tuned here that actually gets added to the insurance tally. That tuning exists on services.fire_service. The name of the tunable is Fire Insurance Claim Percentage.

Tunable.name: apply_depreciation
Tunable.description: Whether or not to apply initial depreciation when this value change is applied. Example: if you are replacing an object that is burned we want to make the value worth the full value of the object again, but you also need to apply the initial depreciation as if it was purchased from buy mode.

TunableVariant.name: environment_score

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins. Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance. IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time. Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point. RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior. APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: inherits

Tunable.name: visibility

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The audio suffix type to override as in audio_constants.py

TunableVariant.name: walkstyle
TunableVariant.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableVariant.name: apply_new_value
TunableVariant.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableTuple.name: request_walkstyle
TunableTuple.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableList.name: additional_run_flags
TunableList.description: Define where the Sim is allowed to run with the walkstyle. It is combined with Run Allowed Flags from the Routing Component and any Additional Run Flags from walkstyle overrides. These flags may be removed by Removed Run Flags from walkstyle overrides. NOTE: This is *additive*, meaning the resulting run flags for a Sim are defined by the default tuning plus all overrides. However, Removed Run Flags is applied last.

Tunable.name: can_replace_with_short_walkstyle
Tunable.description: If checked, this walkstyle can be replaced with the short walkstyle tuned on the routing component if the path distance is shorter than the short walkstyle distance (also tuned on the routing component). Note that if you never want a certain walkstyle to be replaced by the default short walkstyle, you can use the 'short walkstyle map' (also on the routing component) to override it. Also note that if this walkstyle ends up being replaced via 'Combo Walktyle Replacements' (also on the routing component), the replaced walkstyle will not adhere to this tuning.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the walkstyle. Higher priority walkstyles will take precedence over lower priority. Equal priority will favor recent requests.

TunableList.name: removed_run_flags
TunableList.description: Modify a Sim's ability to run. It may disable any Run Allowed Flags from the Routing Component or Additional Run Flags added by walkstyle overrides. NOTE: This is *additive* with respect to all overrides, and is applied to the combination of the default tuning plus Additional Run Flags from all overrides. e.g.: The default behavior for a human is to exclusively run outdoors. A hypothetical 'excitable' trait might add the ability to run indoors (meaning the total result is indoors+outdoors). However, the 'pregnant' trait might remove the ability to run (both outdoors and indoors), effectively preventing the Sim from running at all.

Tunable.name: walkstyle
Tunable.description: The locomotion resource (i.e. walkstyle) to request. Depending on the tuned priority and other requests active on the Sim, this may or may not apply immediately.

TunableVariant.name: wind_speed_level
TunableVariant.description: A State Change Operation Tunable to change an object's speed. [Supported only wind turbine currently.]

TunableTuple.name: apply_new_value
TunableTuple.description: A State Change Operation Tunable to change an object's speed. [Supported only wind turbine currently.]

TunableVariant.name: spin_speed
TunableVariant.description: The spin speed level to set for the sim. The locked float are fixed enums on the client.

Tunable.name: transition_speed
Tunable.description: Set the transition speed of the object. The transition speed defines the speed of the transition between spin speeds.

Tunable.name: test_parent_if_slotted
Tunable.description: If enabled, this test will apply to the object's parent object when it is slotted.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that must pass for this override to apply.

TunableVariant.name: default_value
TunableVariant.description: The default value for the state.

TunableList.name: random
TunableList.description: A weighted list of object states to randomly choose between as the default for this state.

Tunable.name: reset_on_load_if_time_passes
Tunable.display: Reset On Load If Time Passes
Tunable.description: If checked then the object is saved with the default state rather than the current state. If we want it to return to this state we need an interaction that is saved to put it back into it.

Tunable.name: reset_to_default
Tunable.description: If checked, when the object is reset, the state will be reset to the default value. Otherwise, it will keep the current value. This can be overridden by states tuned in tested_states_on_reset.

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_on_add
TunableVariant.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, the fallback state will be applied. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. For example, the Tree Rabbit Hale needs to default to the open state when it's on the Slyvan Glade venue. This runs when the object is added to the world.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_state
TunableVariant.description: If all tests fail, this state will be applied.

TunableList.name: tested_states
TunableList.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_on_location_changed
TunableVariant.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, the fallback state will be applied. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. For example, the boat needs to be set to it's on water state if it is placed on water. This runs when the location of the object changes as long as the object isn't currently routing.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_state
TunableVariant.description: If all tests fail, this state will be applied.

TunableList.name: tested_states

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_on_reset
TunableVariant.description: This is a set of override states for reset_to_default, run when the owner is reset. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, the fallback state will be applied. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. For example, if a chicken parented to the coop is moved in B/B, it should be reset to an InCoop state.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableList.name: tested_states
TunableList.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_on_save
TunableVariant.description: This is a set of override states for reset_on_load_if_time_passes, run when the owner is saved. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, behavior falls back to the condition in reset_on_load_if_time_passes. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. For example, if a chicken is in the coop on save, it should be reset to an InCoop state.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableList.name: tested_states
TunableList.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_post_load
TunableVariant.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, the fallback state will be applied. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. This will run after the zone is fully loaded. This test is mostly used for conditionally applying a state after loading in, or when taking the object out of inventory. (The object has to be previously existing, it will not work for newly created objects.) For example, the previously active gnomes in our HH inventory needs to be reset to the inactive state if we place them after Harvest Fest ends.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_state
TunableVariant.description: If all tests fail, this state will be applied.

TunableList.name: tested_states
TunableList.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: timed_state_triggers
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, when states in this key mapping get triggered, it will trigger states changes at each of the tuned intervals.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Map of state when the timed state triggers will be active and the states to trigger, specific trigger times, and the options of whether to trigger on load.

TunableList.name: ops
TunableList.description: List of multiple states and times when they can be triggered.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of trigger time and states to trigger when the time has passed.

TunableList.name: loot_list
TunableList.description: A list of loot operations to apply when a state change is triggered. Note: Loot will only be applied IF there are any tuned states_to_trigger OR at least one entry in random_states_to_trigger passes its tests

TunableList.name: random_states_to_trigger
TunableList.description: List of randomly weighted states to trigger. Only one will be selected and entries that fail their tests will not be eligible for selection.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableList.name: states_to_trigger
TunableList.description: List of states to trigger.

TunableTuple.name: trigger_tests
TunableTuple.description: After this trigger is activated, these tests will run before any loot or state transitions are processed. Failing these tests will either skip to the next tuned trigger or cause the current trigger to be rescheduled if tuned to do so.

Tunable.name: reschedule_on_failure
Tunable.description: If tuned to true, this trigger will reschedule on test failure instead of skipping to the next trigger.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

Tunable.name: trigger_time
Tunable.description: How many sim minutes past entering the trigger state that this trigger will be enabled. Each entry must occur at a later time than the previous, including the maximum potential of the random offset time. Ex: Entry 1 has a trigger time of 10 and a random offset of 5. Entry 2 must have a trigger time of at least 16.

Tunable.name: trigger_time_random_offset
Tunable.description: A random time offset to be applied to the trigger time. Ex: Trigger Time is 5 and the random offset is 3, the trigger would occur in 5-8 sim minutes.

Tunable.name: trigger_on_load
Tunable.description: If set to True, when the state in the key mapping is set on an object on load the changes are triggered.

TunableVariant.name: unique_state_changes
TunableVariant.description: Special cases that will cause state changes to occur.

Tunable.name: enter_carry_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when entering carry.

Tunable.name: exit_carry_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when exiting carry.

Tunable.name: inside_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed inside.

Tunable.name: natural_ground_placement_lock
Tunable.description: If specified, prevent any natural ground placement state change while the object is in the specified state.

Tunable.name: off_natural_ground_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed off of natural ground.

Tunable.name: on_natural_ground_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed on natural ground.

Tunable.name: outside_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed outside.

TunableList.name: slot_placement
TunableList.description: A list of state changes which will be applied, if their tests pass, when this object is slotted to another object. In these tests, Actor is this object and Target/Object is the parent object.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableList.name: slot_removal
TunableList.description: A list of state changes which will be applied, if their tests pass, when this object is removed from a slot on another object. In these tests, Actor is this object and Target/Object is the parent object.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

TunableList.name: surface_type_placement_states
TunableList.description: Mapping of surface type to the state that should be enabled when an object is placed on that type of surface. State will not be removed if object is off that surface, to do this the other options on the surface types should be tuned. i.e. Pet Ball should IDLE when placed on POOL routing surface, but should be on state OFF when placed on WORLD or OBJECT surfaces.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The surface type that will trigger the state change.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: State to trigger when the object is placed on the specified surface type.

Tunable.name: adjust_sim_positions_dynamically
Tunable.description: Whether this group should attempt to shift Sims around to maximize placement quality.

Tunable.name: disallow_reaction_mixers
Tunable.description: If checked, Sims in this social group will be disallowed from running mixer reactions.

TunableTuple.name: facing_restriction
TunableTuple.description: Controls how a Sim must face the center of a social group. If the range is less than 360, a Sim will be prohibited from socializing if they face away from the center. Because mobile Sims can change their facing, this will mostly affect Sims who are socializing while in objects.

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If set then the facing constraint will have a requirement of facing away from the object instead of towards the object. This will not work if inner_radius is tuned to something other than 0 (actually > EPSILON because RelativeFacingWithCircle doesn't support invert.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableVariant.name: group_leader
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, you can tune the sim participant who will be the leader of this social group. If the leader leaves the group the group will be shutdown.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The leader of the social group.

Tunable.name: include_default_facing_constraint
Tunable.description: If enabled, the default Facing constraint will be included in interactions using this group.

Tunable.name: is_side_group
Tunable.description: If checked, this group represents the sub-set of the sims inside the main social group. It will bring some different social adjustment behavior for sims in the side group.

Tunable.name: is_visible
Tunable.description: If set, then Sims in this group will have a visible representation in the UI, i.e. a Relationship Inspector will be available and Groupobobs will appear.

TunableVariant.name: line_of_sight
TunableVariant.description: A line_of_sight constraint represents an area viewable from a point, so it adapts itself to respect the wall graph. Sims attempting to interact with a group will need to be within this constraint in order to do so. Example: The television has line_of_sight tuned on it. When Sims try to use the television, they will try to route to within the line_of_sight constraint to watch it. This ensures that Sims cannot watch the television from too far away or through walls. There are some valid cases where you'd want this disabled, but be aware that doing so will mean Sims can potentially be in this group and interact with each other through walls. In the case of something like the 'cellDoor' group, we know that any interaction using that group will have the relevant Sims in a specific posture relative to the same object and a LOS constraint is not needed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The line of sight for this social group.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight
TunableTuple.description: The Line of Sight constraint.

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: ' The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

Tunable.name: max_distance_to_snap_to_cluster_sq
Tunable.display: Max Distance To Snap To Cluster Sq
Tunable.description: The maximum distance (in meters) a group constraint will move to snap to a cluster.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum radius of this social group

Tunable.name: maximum_sim_count
Tunable.description: The maximum number of Sims in this social group.

Tunable.name: minimum_sim_count
Tunable.description: The minimum number of Sims in this social group; if fewer Sims are in the group it will be destroyed.

Tunable.name: radius_scale
Tunable.description: Determines the baseline radius of the social group. The ideal social group radius increases as the number of Sims increases, based on the formula: radius_scale * sqrt(num_sims / 2). So if there are two Sims, the ideal group will be exactly this size, and if there are four Sims, it will be 1.4142 * radius_scale.

TunableVariant.name: social_anchor_object
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, you can tune a participant to be the anchor the social group is constructed around. Game groups tune the anchor to the object the game targets. If disabled, the group_leader, if tuned, will be the anchor.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The anchor the social group forms around.

Tunable.name: time_until_posture_changes
Tunable.description: The length of time a Sim must be in the social group before they will consider changing postures.
